Welcome to Contacts Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API contacts_¶

async contacts_.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The custom_middleware function is a middleware function that will be called before the request is passed to the route handler. It will catch any SQLAlchemy errors and return them as JSON responses, and it will add a performance header to every response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the request to the next middleware in line

Returns:

A response object

Doc-author:

Trelent

contacts_.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the database connection. It returns a JSON object with the message &quot;Welcome to FastAPI&quot; if everything is working correctly.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async contacts_.limit_access_by_ip(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The limit_access_by_ip function is a middleware function that limits access to the API by IP address. It checks if the client’s IP address is in ALLOWED_IPS, and if not, returns a 403 Forbidden response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the pipeline

Returns:

A jsonresponse object with a status code of 403

Doc-author:

Trelent

async contacts_.root()¶

The root function is a simple HTTP endpoint that returns a JSON object containing the message &quot;Here your contacts!&quot;.

Returns:

A dict, so we can use the json() middleware

Doc-author:

Trelent

async contacts_.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as caches or databases.

Returns:

The fastapilimiter instance

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.birthdays(user: User, db: Session)¶

The birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.check(contact: Contact, user: User, db)¶

The check function is used to check if a contact already exists in the database. If it does, then we create a record for that user and contact in the UserToContact table.

Parameters:

  • contact – Contact: Pass the contact object to the function

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that the user does not have in their contact list

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes in a ContactModel object, which is validated by pydantic and then converted into an SQLAlchemy model. The function then adds the contact to the database and commits it. If there are any errors, they are caught and rolled back.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Create a new contact object

  • user – User: Get the user id of the logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.create_record(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The create_record function creates a new record in the UserToContact table.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be added to the user’s list. user (User): The current logged-in user, whose list will be updated with this new contact. db (Session): A database session object that is used for querying and updating records in our database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact that is being added to the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The created record

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_all(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_all function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Determine the starting point of the query

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database

if it exists.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Pass in the contact id of the contact to be retrieved

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_ids(user: User, db: Session) → list[int]¶

The get_contact_ids function takes a user and database session as arguments. It returns a list of contact ids associated with the given user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact_ids

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The remove function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search(parameter: str | int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The search function is used to search for contacts in the database. It takes a parameter, which can be either a string or an integer, and searches through all of the attributes of Contact objects in the database. The function returns a list of Contact objects that match any attribute with the given parameter.

Parameters:

  • parameter – str | int: Search for a contact in the database

  • user – User: Get the user’s contact list

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts, which match the search parameter

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶
The update function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to delete

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirm_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

The confirm_email function takes an email and a database session as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user with that email address, and sets their confirmed field to True. It then commits this change to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

Nothing, so the return type is none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object to be created. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the user data to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address of a user to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the user exists, or none if it doesn’t

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.reset_password(user: User, new_password: str, db: Session)¶

The reset_password function takes a user and new_password as arguments, and updates the password of the user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • new_password – str: Pass in the new password

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session)¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user that is being updated

  • url – str: Update the avatar of a user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh_token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we return an error message. If they do exist but their account has already been confirmed, we return a message saying so. If neither of these are true (i.e., the account exists and hasn’t been confirmed yet), then we call repository_users’ confirm_email function with that email address as its argument.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the email and password of the user, verifies them against those stored in the database, and returns an access token if they match.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

An access token and a refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function will check if the user has a valid refresh token and then create a new access token for them. If they do not have a valid refresh_token, it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A new access token and refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email the user with a link that will confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. The function then checks if the user exists and if they are already confirmed. If they do exist and are not yet confirmed, it sends them an email using the send_email() function from utils/mailgun_api.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Receive the email from the user

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(body: PasswordResetModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

It takes in the email of the user and their new password, which must be confirmed by entering it again. If the email does not exist or if the passwords do not match, an error will be thrown.

Parameters:

  • body – PasswordResetModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the message &quot;password reset complete!&quot;

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_task: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes in a UserModel object, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using the auth_password module and then stored in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the request body

  • background_task – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object, which is then serialized and returned as a response

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes in a ContactModel object, which is validated by pydantic. If the validation fails, an HTTPException is raised with status code 400 (Bad Request).

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Specify the data that is required to create a contact

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • current_user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database connection

Returns:

The deleted contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the current month.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday today

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. The function takes in an integer as a path parameter, and uses it to query for the contact. If no such contact exists, then an HTTP 404 error is returned.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_by(parameter: str | int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The search_by function searches for a contact by name or phone number.

The function takes in the parameter to search by, the current user, and a database session. It then calls on the repository_contacts module’s search function to perform this task. If no contacts are found, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404 Not Found.

Parameters:

  • parameter – str | int: Search for a contact by name or phone number

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id, body and current_user as parameters. It returns a ContactModel object if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current_user object, which is the user that has been authenticated

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Access the database

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

get_current_active_user endpoint. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it exists, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current object

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
red = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
class src.services.auth.Hash¶

Bases: object

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function is a helper function that uses the passlib library to hash the password. The hashing algorithm used by this function is PBKDF2 with HMAC-SHA256, which is considered secure and recommended for most applications.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

password_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the verify method of the PasswordContext object to check if they match. If they do, it returns True; otherwise, it returns False.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is being verified

  • hashed_password – Check if the password is correct

Returns:

True or false

Doc-author:

Trelent

class src.services.auth.Token¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'algorithm'¶
SECRET_KEY_A = 'secret'¶
SECRET_KEY_R = 'secret'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • data – dict: A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function is used to create a token that will be sent to the user’s email address. The token contains the following data:

  • iat (issued at): The time when the token was created.

  • exp (expiration): The time when this token expires and becomes invalid. This is set to 1 day from now, but can be changed in settings if needed.

  • scope: A string indicating what this particular JWT can do/what it has access to on our server side code.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token. The time

in seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which is 7 days from creation date. :return: A refresh token that is encoded with the secret key :doc-author: Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an exception if the token is invalid or has expired. If it’s valid, it returns the email address of the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user, which is stored in the sub claim

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY_A and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of &quot;email_token&quot;. If so, it returns the sub (subject) field from the payload. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 Unauthorized.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Cloud_Image¶

class src.services.cloud_image.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

static generate_name_avatar(email: str)¶

The generate_name_avatar function takes an email address as input and returns a unique avatar name. The function uses the first 12 characters of the SHA256 hash of the email address to generate a unique string, which is then used as part of an avatar name. The function returns this avatar name.

Parameters:

email – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

static get_url_for_avatar(public_id, r)¶

The get_url_for_avatar function takes in a public_id and an r (which is the result of a cloudinary.api.resource call) and returns the URL for that avatar image, which will be used to display it on the page.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Identify the image in cloudinary

  • r – Get the version of the image

Returns:

The url for the avatar image

Doc-author:

Trelent

static upload(file, public_id: str)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. The function then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided. If no public_id is provided, one will be generated automatically.

Parameters:

  • file – Specify the file to be uploaded

  • public_id – str: Set the public id of the image

Returns:

A dict with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link that they can click on to verify their email address. The function takes in three parameters:

-email: The user’s email address, which is used as the recipient of the message. -username: The username of the user, which is used in a greeting within the body of the message. -host: The hostname (domain) where this application is running, which will be included in a link within

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass in the host of the website

Returns:

A coroutine object, which is a generator-based asynchronous function

Doc-author:

Trelent
